title: 51-E
statement: E. Pentagontime limit per test10 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutAccording to the last order issued by the president of Berland every city of the country must have its own Ministry Defense building (their own Pentagon). A megapolis Berbourg was not an exception. This city hasnjunctions, some pairs of which are connected by two-way roads. Overall there aremroads in the city, no more than one between each pair of junctions.At the moment choosing a location place for Pentagon in Berbourg is being discussed. It has been decided that Pentagon should cover the territory of five different junctions which are joined into a cycle by roads. In the order to build Pentagon a special wall will be built along the roads (with high-tension razor, high-voltage wire and other attributes). Thus, the number of possible ways of building Pentagon in the city is equal to the number of different cycles at lengths of 5, composed of junctions and roads.Your task is to prints the number of ways of building Pentagon in Berbourg. Only well-optimized solutions will be accepted. Please, test your code on the maximal testcase.InputThe first line contains two integersnandm(1 ≤n≤ 700;0 ≤m≤n·(n- 1) / 2), wherenrepresents the number of junctions andmis the number of roads in the city. Then followmlines containing the road descriptions, one in each line. Every road is set by a number of integersai,bi(1 ≤ai,bi≤n;ai≠bi), whereaiandbirepresent the numbers of junctions, connected by the road. The junctions are numbered from 1 ton. It is not guaranteed that from any junction one can get to any other one moving along the roads.OutputPrint the single number which represents the required number of ways. Please, do not use%lldspecificator to read or write 64-bit integers in C++. It is preffered to usecout(also you may use%I64d).ExamplesInput5 51 22 33 44 55 1Output1Input5 101 21 31 41 52 32 42 53 43 54 5Output12

processed.result: You are given a map with cities connected by roads.  Find the number of ways to choose 5 cities that form a closed loop.

There are $n$ junctions and $m$ roads in a city. Each road connects two different junctions.  You need to find the number of ways to choose 5 junctions that form a cycle (a closed loop) using the roads.  

**Input:**

* The first line contains two integers, $n$ and $m$ ($1 \le n \le 700$, $0 \le m \le n(n-1)/2$), representing the number of junctions and roads, respectively.
* The next $m$ lines each contain two integers, $a_i$ and $b_i$ ($1 \le a_i, b_i \le n$, $a_i \neq b_i$), representing a road connecting junctions $a_i$ and $b_i$.

**Output:**

* Print a single integer representing the number of ways to form a cycle of 5 junctions.
